oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How to Deal with Party Politics at School? (1964)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Engelhardt, Rudolf
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Might the teacher’s political point of view not have an impact on his pupils concerning the way he is going to deal with current political issues? According to the above discussed caricature [interpreting a political caricature is the previous case Engelhardt discusses, HL], this neither caused any difficulties nor did it have a negative effect in a political sense. Hence, whatever political party the teacher might belong to or favor, it should not have an effect on the way this caricature is interpreted or evaluated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: JSSE - Journal of Social Science Education; 3-2010: Qualitative Research – Voices from Civic Education Classrooms
JSSE - Journal of Social Science Education; 3-2010: Qualitative Research – Voices from Civic Education Classrooms
